# Phoenix LiveView
> Core concepts, lifecycle callbacks, event handling, state management, and best practices for building interactive, real-time web applications with Phoenix LiveView using server-rendered HTML over WebSockets.

## Resources
* [Phoenix LiveView Guide](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/Phoenix.LiveView.html): Official guide and Hexdocs for the core `Phoenix.LiveView` behaviour, covering lifecycle (`mount`, `handle_params`, `handle_event`, `handle_info`, `render`), assigns, and event handling.
* [HEEx Templates (`.html.heex`)](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/assigns-eex.html): Documentation on the HEEx template syntax used by LiveView.
* [Function Components (`Phoenix.Component`)](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/Phoenix.Component.html): Hexdocs for defining stateless, reusable UI components.
* [Live Components (`Phoenix.LiveComponent`)](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/Phoenix.LiveComponent.html): Hexdocs for defining stateful, reusable UI components with their own lifecycle.
* [Live Navigation](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/live_navigation.html): Guide covering `live_patch` and `live_redirect` for navigating between LiveViews.
* [JavaScript Interoperability](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/js-interop.html): Guide covering client-side hooks and events (`push_event`).
* [Understanding LiveView](https://hexdocs.pm/phoenix_live_view/understanding_liveview.html): Conceptual overview of how LiveView works.
